Dry meads go with dinner, sweet meads are for after dinner and sparkling meads are for drinking on their own. A mead like Antinomy is an excellent choice as a pairing wine with steaks, stews, chili and other dark, heavy meals.                  You could also try Skol, but it may not pair quite as perfectly as Antinomy.
